meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a runt in size or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The puppy was so runtish that it could fit in the palm of my hand.
meanings.sent2: The runtish kitten struggled to keep up with its siblings.
meanings.sent3: The runtish piglet tried to oink as loudly as its larger brothers.
meanings.sent4: The runtish flower in the garden stood out like a tiny jewel.
meanings.sent5: Her runtish stature made her easy to overlook in the crowd.

meanings.definition: Having the qualities or characteristics of a runt.
meanings.sent1: Despite his runtish nature, he had a big heart full of kindness.
meanings.sent2: The runtish duckling was determined to prove its worth to the flock.
meanings.sent3: The runtish squirrel surprised everyone with its acrobatic skills.
meanings.sent4: Her runtish voice carried a powerful message that resonated with many.
meanings.sent5: The runtish tree may be small, but it provides shade just like the others.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a runt in a diminutive or undersized manner.
meanings.sent1: The runtish apple may be tiny, but it packs a lot of flavor.
meanings.sent2: Her runtish hands struggled to hold the heavy book.
meanings.sent3: The runtish car sputtered along the road, barely keeping up with traffic.
meanings.sent4: His runtish backpack was filled to the brim with school supplies.
meanings.sent5: The runtish boat bobbed in the water, dwarfed by the larger ships.
